name: A Die in the Sky
description:
Submission for the GMTK Game Jam 2022. 

You play as a die rolling around in the sky. Solve puzzles and advance to the next stage. Definitely more I could do with it and I have more ideas for it, but again, 2 day jam. Had to keep the scope in check. Even with that scope there's 10 levels, and a 'more RNG' mode, so I feel like that's pretty good for a 2 day Jam.

Controls

  • WASD/Arrows to Move
  • ESC to open Menu
  • Mouse to Click Buttons
  • R to reload level without needing to open menu

Noteworthy Bugs

  • For some reason, the WebGL build just stops playing music around the 7th level. The Windows build is perfectly fine, it's just the WebGL build and I have no idea why.  So, I guess the Windows version is the better option for sound, but the WebGL one is still the easiest to play.
  • The way the randomization works, it can sometimes make the level actually impossible. I probably could've tried to fix it, but 2 day scope, so there's an option to reload the level and reroll the numbers which should fix it eventually.

(Holy shit, it's been almost a year since I've done anything. God it feels good to be back and do game design stuff. 

Also, Why did I make a puzzle game, I'm not a smart person)
developers: Duck In A Top Hat Games
